en: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, Than a house full of feasting with strife.
hmr: Inhal puma ruoiṭhe rawpna insûng nêk chun, Lungdamtaka bu bâr khat fâkna a ṭha lem.

en: A servant that dealeth wisely shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, And shall have part in the inheritance among the brethren.
hmr: Siehlaw vartaka thaw hlaktu chun naupa, inzakna intlun hlaktu, chunga chun rorêl a tih. Unauhai laiah rochan nei bawk a tih.

en: The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold; But Jehovah trieth the hearts.
hmr: Rawtuina bêl chu tangkaruo ta ding a na, pûm mei chu rângkachak ta ding a nih, LALPA ruok chun lungril a fie hlak.

en: An evil-doer giveth heed to wicked lips; And a liar giveth ear to a mischievous tongue.
hmr: Thil suol thawtu chun hmûr khawhlohai chu a ngaisak a, Chun mi khêlinhlip chun lei pawitâwk tieng chun na a sit.

en: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker; And he that is glad at calamity shall not be unpunished.
hmr: Tukhawm mi pasie nuisan chun a siemtu a hmusit a nih. Vângduoina diriemtu chu hrem lo ni naw nih.

en: Children’s children are the crown of old men; And the glory of children are their fathers.
hmr: Nauhai nauhai chu mi upahai lallukhum an na, Chun, nauhai ropuina chu an pahai chu an nih.

en: Excellent speech becometh not a fool; Much less do lying lips a prince.
hmr: Thuhril ṭhatak le invêt ân mawi ngai nawh a, Hmûr khêlinhlip chu lal nau leh ân mawi naw nâwk zuol.

en: A bribe is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it; Whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.
hmr: Thamna hi a neitu ta ding chun mithaia lung hlutak ang a na, Ân her vêlna taphawta chun a hlawtling hlak.

en: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; But he that harpeth on a matter separateth chief friends.
hmr: Bawsietna inkhumtu chun hmangaina a zawng a, Thil hril hriltu ruok chun ṭhien bul a ṭhe.

en: A rebuke entereth deeper into one that hath understanding Than a hundred stripes into a fool.
hmr: Kâwkna hi hrietna nei mia chun a lût thûk lem, Invêt vawi za khat vuok nêk hmanin.

en: An evil man seeketh only rebellion; Therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
hmr: Mi rilo chun hêlna chau a zawng a, Chuleiin, ama kuoma chun mitir nunsetak tir nîng a tih.

en: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, Rather than a fool in his folly.
hmr: Invêt ân vêt laia intuokpui nêk chun, Savawmpui a tehai inrûkpêka um intuokpui nuom a um lem.

en: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, Evil shall not depart from his house.
hmr: Tukhawm thil ṭha aia thil ṭha naw pe lem chu, Thil ṭha naw a ina inthawkin fe hmang ngai naw nih.

en: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: Therefore leave off contention, before there is quarrelling.
hmr: Insuolna hung inṭan dân hi miin tui a hersuok ang chau a nih, Chuleiin, inhalna chu insuolna a um hmain mâksan rawh.

en: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the righteous, Both of them alike are an abomination to Jehovah.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chu thiem inchangtir a, mi fel chu thiemnaw inchangtir chu, Chu ve vehai chu angkhata LALPA ta dinga tirdakum a nih.

en: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, Seeing he hath no understanding?
hmr: Hrietthiemna a nei naw chun, Varna inchâwkna man ding invêt kuta chun ieng dingin am um a ta?

en: A friend loveth at all times; And a brother is born for adversity.
hmr: Ṭhien chun ieng lai khawmin a hmangai a, Unau chu lunginzîng ni dinga pieng a nih.

en: A man void of understanding striketh hands, And becometh surety in the presence of his neighbor.
hmr: Mi hrietthiemna nei lo chun a kuthai a ben a, A tuolbâwm hmaihmaa chun mawphurtu a hung ni hlak.

en: He loveth transgression that loveth strife: He that raiseth high his gate seeketh destruction.
hmr: Bawsietna ngainatu chun inhalna khawm a ngaina a, A dâi kawtkhâr dawm sângtu chun sietna a zawng a nih.

en: He that hath a wayward heart findeth no good; And he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.
hmr: Lungril chapo neitu chun thil ṭha a hmu ngai nawh a, Lei khêlinhlip neitu chu pawitâwknaah a tlu lût hlak.

en: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow; And the father of a fool hath no joy.
hmr: Nau invêt neitu chun a lungngaina chau dinga nei a na, Chun, invêt pa chun hlimna a nei bawk nawh.

en: A cheerful heart is a good medicine; But a broken spirit drieth up the bones.
hmr: Lungril hlim chu damdawi ṭha a na, Lungril serawp ruok chun ruhai a sukṭâwl.

en: A wicked man receiveth a bribe out of the bosom, To pervert the ways of justice.
hmr: Mi khawhlo chun ângsûnga inthawkin thilthlâwnpêk chu a lâk a, Rorêlna lampuihai chu a sukkâwi hlak.

en: Wisdom is before the face of him that hath understanding; But the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
hmr: Varna chu hrietthiemna neitu hmaihmaa chun a um a, Invêt mithai ruok chu leihnuoi tâwpa chun an um.

en: A foolish son is a grief to his father, And bitterness to her that bare him.
hmr: Naupa invêt chu a pa ta dinga lunginrimna a na, A neitu nu ta ding chun rimsikna a nih.

en: Also to punish the righteous is not good, Nor to smite the noble for their uprightness.
hmr: Mi fel inchawitir chu a ṭha nawh a, Mi ṭha an tluongna leia vuok khawm chu a ṭha chuong nawh.

en: He that spareth his words hath knowledge; And he that is of a cool spirit is a man of understanding.
hmr: A thuhai hla tâwk nei mi chun hrietthiemna a nei a, Lungril dei nei mi chu hrietthiemna nei mi a nih.

en: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise; When he shutteth his lips, he is esteemed as prudent.
hmr: Invêt khawm, a to ṭawk lai chun mi vara ngai a na, A hmûrhai ân chip tlat lai chun mi var anga ngai a nih.
